After having completed the game I now understand why everyone wants a
Half life 3. 

But here's the deal:

- I cannot ensure you that you will like it if you are a "modern" games lover
- If possible try first half life 2 ( and the following episodes 1 and 2);

√áocukluƒüumda internet yokken bu oyunu neden yapmƒ±≈ülar diyip oyunun nline olduƒüunu √∂ƒürenince deli gibi oynadƒ±ƒüƒ±m vakitler nerden nereye(hikayesi olduƒüunu bilmiyordum √ßocukken)
Better than Half-Life 2.  The pinnacle of first person shooters.  As makers of various games invest in graphics, the creativity of their investment suffers.

Dr. Gordon Freeman is a bearded MIT graduate with an insatiable blood lust for the United States Marine Corp. Despite this, he is a pure bred American who can carry like 14 weapons and use them to carefully annihilate any alien creature, soldier, space baby, or science team member with ease. In this 1998 classic, you get to traverse the immense area that is the Black Mesa Research Facility in New Mexico. Being that you are a theoretical physicist wearing a reasonably comfy power suit; you'll find that the puzzles and combat are pretty engaging. This is true of course so long as you block out the immensely annoying to go backwards in a power rail cart. But what can I tell you? Only the finest level design choices of the Anomalous Materials science team. This true coming of age story unfolds with Gordon Learning the secrets of his universe and learning to cope with the world as it is.

I have 7 other HL games downloaded and all but 2 play perfectly. The 2 i'm having problems with are half life and half life caged, neither of which will play. What happens , i will select half life ( original ) and click play , then a white screen pops up and thats it, no game. I personally had at least 3 of the games on disk at one time until someone wanted them more then me but i love the game(s). 
 What confuses me , why would all the other games play but the one that started it all won't.
  Having said that , i highly recommend all of HF games , i havent read or heard any other complaints so i'm assuming it's my gaming machine. 
  If you download it and it works , i salute you . On the other hand , if anyone has downloaded it and got the same thing as i did and figured it out , PLEASE let me know. Thanks
  HAPPY GAMING.

A classic.
Even though this was made in 1998, this game aged very well and can easily be one of my favorite games!
This game has a good story to tell instead of being a run n' gun. 

I totally recomend it for you if you like old games and FPS.

Half-Life. Yup, the original Half-Life.
I set off on this game to find the story it has been told to have, and it was supposedly great, too. Now while I'm not the hugest fan of Half-Life, I cannot give you the best in-depth analysis of the characters, nor about the story, but one thing is for sure - Gordon Freeman and his trust ol' crowbar sure are a good mix!
I won't even get to the story too much to not spoil anything, but basically you fight a ton of mutants and get yelled at by funny sounding professors.
And don't worry, the game mechanics are top-notch realism at its best. For example, bunnyhopping and item boosting are only a few examples of that.
This game is still known and still relevant mostly because of it's notable speedrunning scene. It's why most people still get up and play this game, but to me that has never been appealing. Yes, it looks cool, but I can't see myself dedicating that much time to fly through an ancient game.
By todays standards I'd still give this game a 7/10, because of what the game brings to the speedrunning scene in particular.
